author: craigmcc
msg: Implement substantial changes to ApplicationDispatcher (the request
dispatcher implementation class for Catalina) to support the new 2.3
ability for servlets to wrap the request and response objects that they
pass to forward() or include().  Previously, servlets were required to use
the original request and response objects.  This is the largest single
impact change required by Servlet 2.3.
Be sure you pick up the updates to the "jakarta-servletapi" module, which
fixes a problem with getSession() returning null on all session related
events.
As of now, Tomcat 4.0 passes all but one of the Watchdog servlet tests
(the one that checks for version 2.2 :-), and all but one of the JSP tests
(positiveInclude.jsp, which needs further investigation).

author: craigmcc
msg: Add an example Filter implementation that is configured two different ways
-- once for the "invoker" servlet by name, and once for the url pattern
"/servlet/*".  Because of the way that the Catalina invoker servlet works,
the first request to a particular invoked servlet will trigger both
filters, while subsequent requests will only invoke the path mapped filter
(because the invoker servlet registers a new servlet with an exact path
mapping that bypasses it on subsequent requests).
